Welcome to the Rashid Lab! This guide will help you get set up and productive in your first weeks.

## First Steps

1. **Complete administrative tasks** - HR paperwork, building access, etc.
2. **Set up your computing environment** - See [Tools Setup](tools-setup.qmd)
3. **Learn GitHub basics** - See [GitHub Fundamentals](github-fundamentals.qmd) (essential for collaboration!)
4. **Read the coding standards** - [Coding Standards](../coding-standards/index.qmd)
5. **Understand our meeting workflow** - See [Lab Meetings](../policies/meetings.qmd)
6. **Clone the starter template** - Get your first project going

## Key Resources

| Resource | Purpose |
|----------|---------|
| Lab Teams | Daily communication (invite sent by Dr. Rashid) |
| [GitHub Organization](https://github.com/rashidlab) | All code repositories |
| [Lab Meeting Discussions](https://github.com/rashidlab/lab-handbook/discussions/categories/lab-meetings) | Weekly agendas & notes |
| [Meeting Schedule](../policies/schedule.qmd) | Rotation and calendar |
| [Longleaf Docs](https://help.rc.unc.edu/longleaf-cluster/) | UNC HPC cluster |

## Your First Week

### Day 1-2: Environment Setup

- [ ] Get Onyen and UNC credentials
- [ ] Request Longleaf account
- [ ] Install R, RStudio, and essential packages
- [ ] Set up Git and GitHub access
- [ ] Join lab Teams channels

### Day 3-4: Orientation

- [ ] Meet with Dr. Rashid for project overview
- [ ] Review existing lab projects
- [ ] Read 2-3 relevant papers
- [ ] Attend lab meeting

### Day 5: First Code

- [ ] Clone a project template
- [ ] Run the example pipeline
- [ ] Make a small modification
- [ ] Submit your first commit

## Questions?

- **Technical questions**: Post in `#computing` Teams channel
- **Project questions**: Ask your project mentor or Dr. Rashid
- **Administrative**: Contact lab coordinator
